5376.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ
5376.verse-english: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen

clauses-arabic.clause: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ سَأَلَ سَائِلٌ بِعَذَابٍ وَاقِعٍ

clauses-english.clause: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen

5377.verse-english: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.

clauses-english.clause: To the disbelievers;
of it there is no preventer.

5378.verse-english: [It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.

clauses-english.clause: [It is] from God,
owner of the ways of ascent.

5379.verse-arabic: تَعْرُجُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ
5379.verse-english: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.

clauses-arabic.clause: تَعْرُجُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالرُّوحُ إِلَيْهِ فِي يَوْمٍ كَانَ مِقْدَارُهُ خَمْسِينَ أَلْفَ سَنَةٍ

clauses-english.clause: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.

5380.verse-english: So be patient with gracious patience.

clauses-english.clause: So be patient with gracious patience.
Indeed,
they see it [as] distant,
But We see it [as] near.

5383.verse-english: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,

clauses-english.clause: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,

5384.verse-english: And the mountains will be like wool,

clauses-english.clause: And the mountains will be like wool,

5385.verse-english: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

clauses-english.clause: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

5386.verse-arabic: يُبَصَّرُونَهُمْ ۚ يَوَدُّ الْمُجْرِمُ لَوْ يَفْتَدِي مِنْ عَذَابِ يَوْمِئِذٍ بِبَنِيهِ
5386.verse-english: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children

clauses-english.clause: They will be shown each other.
The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children

5387.verse-english: And his wife and his brother

clauses-english.clause: And his wife and his brother

5388.verse-english: And his nearest kindred who shelter him

clauses-english.clause: And his nearest kindred who shelter him

5389.verse-arabic: وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ
5389.verse-english: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.

clauses-arabic.clause: وَمَن فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا ثُمَّ يُنجِيهِ

clauses-english.clause: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.

5390.verse-english: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],

clauses-english.clause: No!
Indeed,
it is the Flame [of Hell],
A remover of exteriors.

5392.verse-english: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]

clauses-english.clause: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]
And collected [wealth] and hoarded.
Indeed,
mankind was created anxious:
When evil touches him,
impatient,

5396.verse-english: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],

clauses-english.clause: And when good touches him,
withholding [of it],
Except the observers of prayer -

5398.verse-english: Those who are constant in their prayer

clauses-english.clause: Those who are constant in their prayer

5399.verse-english: And those within whose wealth is a known right

clauses-english.clause: And those within whose wealth is a known right

5400.verse-english: For the petitioner and the deprived -

clauses-english.clause: For the petitioner and the deprived -

5401.verse-english: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

clauses-english.clause: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

5402.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ
5402.verse-english: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -

clauses-arabic.clause: وَالَّذِينَ هُم مِّنْ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشْفِقُونَ

clauses-english.clause: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -

5403.verse-english: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -

5404.verse-english: And those who guard their private parts

clauses-english.clause: And those who guard their private parts

5405.verse-arabic: إِلَّا عَلَىٰ أَزْوَاجِهِمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ غَيْرُ مَلُومِينَ
5405.verse-english: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -

clauses-english.clause: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess,
for indeed,
they are not to be blamed -

5406.verse-arabic: فَمَنِ ابْتَغَىٰ وَرَاءَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْعَادُونَ
5406.verse-english: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -

clauses-english.clause: But whoever seeks beyond that,
then they are the transgressors -

5407.verse-english: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive

clauses-english.clause: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive

5408.verse-english: And those who are in their testimonies upright

clauses-english.clause: And those who are in their testimonies upright

5409.verse-english: And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:

clauses-english.clause: And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:

5410.verse-english: They will be in gardens, honored.

clauses-english.clause: They will be in gardens,
honored.

5411.verse-english: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muhammad],

clauses-english.clause: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve,
hastening [from] before you,
[O Muhammad],

5412.verse-english: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?

clauses-english.clause: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?

5413.verse-arabic: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ
5413.verse-english: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?

clauses-arabic.clause: أَيَطْمَعُ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُدْخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِيمٍ

clauses-english.clause: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?

5414.verse-english: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.

clauses-english.clause: No!
Indeed,
We have created them from that which they know.

5415.verse-arabic: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ الْمَشَارِقِ وَالْمَغَارِبِ إِنَّا لَقَادِرُونَ
5415.verse-english: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able

clauses-arabic.clause: فَلَا أُقْسِمُ بِرَبِّ الْمَشَارِقِ وَالْمَغَارِبِ إِنَّا لَقَادِرُونَ

clauses-english.clause: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able

5416.verse-arabic: عَلَىٰ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَيْرًا مِّنْهُمْ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
5416.verse-english: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.

clauses-english.clause: To replace them with better than them;
and We are not to be outdone.

5417.verse-arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
5417.verse-english: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -

clauses-arabic.clause: فَذَرْهُمْ يَخُوضُوا وَيَلْعَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ

clauses-english.clause: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -

5418.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ يَخْرُجُونَ مِنَ الْأَجْدَاثِ سِرَاعًا كَأَنَّهُمْ إِلَىٰ نُصُبٍ يُوفِضُونَ
5418.verse-english: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.

clauses-english.clause: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were,
toward an erected idol,
hastening.

5419.verse-arabic: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ الْيَوْمُ الَّذِي كَانُوا يُوعَدُونَ
5419.verse-english: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.

clauses-english.clause: Their eyes humbled,
humiliation will cover them.
That is the Day which they had been promised.
